result.execSummary:
The defendant Kerstin M Ohrmundt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$500.00 BAIL APPLIED. $18.00 remains and to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Defendant may have contact with her father unless her father states otherwise and advises the Probation Agent.
No contact with Christopher S.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

Court finds that if the Defendant successfully completes probation and has no new criminal law violations, Court will find that it is in the Defendant's interest to have this expunged and society will not be harmed and grant expunction.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - 1st 8 months STRAIGHT TIME. Credit for 138 days.
Last 4 months STAYED and the Defendant to be released from jail to Day Report Center for compliance for 4 months.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Sentence credit 574 days was granted. 
Commencing forthwith.

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No contact with Christopher S.  
  Defendant may have contact with her father unless her father states otherwise and advises the Probation Agent.
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  Maintain full time employment and/or school combination.
  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Costs previously ordered by the Court to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Defendant IS Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: from August 23, 2017 Sentencing After Revocation

Defendant Kerstin M Ohrmundt in court, in custody, with attorney Katherine Graber.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #2:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

5 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 574 days) Sentence commencing forthwith;
  -  2 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
- Conditions of  Extended Supervision: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. Defendant may have contact with her father unless her father states otherwise and advises the Probation Agent. No contact with Christopher S..  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.

COSTS: Previously ordered by the Court to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  

Count #4:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

5 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (consecutive to count #2)
  -  2 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Same as count #2;

COSTS: Previously ordered by the Court to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

From Florence Ohrmundt dated 8/17/17 re sentencing.
**Reviewed by Judge Michael J. Aprahamian on 8/22/17.**

Defendant Kerstin M Ohrmundt in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2 and 4.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1 and Ct 3 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
- Sentence withheld for 4 years Probation - concurrent to Ct. 4
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. Defendant may have contact with her father unless her father states otherwise and advises the Probation Agent. No contact with Christopher S..  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided
 - 1 Year jail. 1st 8 months jail straight time - Condition Time - 138 days credit. Last 4 months STAYED and the defendant to be released from jail to Day Report Center for compliance for 4 months.  

Ct. 4:
- Sentence withheld for 4 years Probation - concurrent to Ct. 2
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s.. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
